title: Volkswagen sets up self-driving business in race to catch up with Google
text:
Volkswagen is seeking to take on tech giants such as Google’s Waymo in the race to create self-driving systems for cars.

The German automotive giant is setting up a standalone business called Volkswagen Autonomy (VWAT) to develop “Level 4” self-driving.

This is defined as vehicles that can drive themselves in most circumstances without human intervention, but can still be overridden.

VWAT will be established in Munich and Wolfsburg, with subsidiaries in Silicon Valley and China over the next two years. VW’s research on the autonomous vehicles will be transferred to VWAT.

The company - which is putting €44bn (£38bn) into electric and self-driving cars - said VWAT will build up know-how within...
description: Volkswagen is seeking to take on tech giants such as Google’s Waymo in the race to create self-driving systems for cars.
